<root><template><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> local </value></part><part><name>Multiplayer Effects</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Sounds </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Plays music defined in [[Description.ext#CfgMusic|Description.ext's CfgMusic]] or config.cpp.
* [[Arma 3 CfgMusic]]
* [[Arma 2: Music]]
* [[Arma: cfgMusic]]

<template lineStart="1"><title>Informative </title><part><name index="1"/><value> To stop the music, use <template><title>Inline code</title><part><name index="1"/><value>[[playMusic]] ""</value></part></template>.</value></part></template>

<template lineStart="1"><title>Feature arma3 </title><part><name index="1"/><value> See [[Arma 3 CfgMusic]] for possible vanilla values. Since <template><title>arma3</title></template> v1.67 one can use the [[Arma_3_Utilities#Jukebox|Jukebox Utility]] to preview in-game music.</value></part></template> </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> [[playMusic]] musicName </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> musicName: [[String]] - music classname </value></part><part><name>Parameter1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value>[[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>s2</name>=<value> [[playMusic]] [musicName, start] </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p21</name>=<value> musicName: [[String]] - music classname </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER21</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p22</name>=<value> start: [[Number]] - start, in seconds. Can be negative. </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER22</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>r2</name>=<value> [[Nothing]] </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>[[playMusic]] "RadioAmbient1";</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x2</name>=<value> <code>[[playMusic]] ["RadioAmbient3", 3]; <template><title>cc</title><part><name index="1"/><value>start to play from 00:00:03</value></part></template></code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE2</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>x3</name>=<value> Play from 00:00:01 to 00:00:05:
<code>[] [[spawn]] {
	[[playMusic]] ["RadioAmbient5", 1];
	[[sleep]] 4;
	[[playMusic]] "";
};</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE3</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[getMusicPlayedTime]], [[playSound]], [[say]], [[createSoundSource]], [[addMusicEventHandler]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>
